stream_context.summary: Kaze implemented and debugged several complex, animated star select screen backgrounds provided by artist Biobak. The main activities involved fixing a frustrating compiler-related sine wave bug for a submarine animation and implementing a multi-stage bird animation, while also discussing future level themes and a redesign of the game's overworld.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is implementing custom, animated backgrounds for each course's star select screen to make the menu system more dynamic and immersive.
development_findings.quote: The way this looks, I don't think we need that. This actually just looks fine the way it is.

development_findings.summary: Kaze spent a significant amount of time debugging an animation, ultimately discovering it was a compiler issue where a missing header file caused a function to link to garbage data instead of producing an error.
development_findings.quote: What the fuck how can it just link garbage data and not tell me... I take no blame for that.

development_findings.summary: Kaze solved a visual artifact on a 3D model (an 'X' shape on a light) by remodeling it with more vertices rather than attempting a more complex code or shader fix.
Kaze revealed the five planned 'Retro Section' themes but noted he is not fully satisfied with the list and is open to better ideas.
development_findings.quote: We have Paper Mario 64 Goomba Town, Mario Paint, Dr. Mario, Mario Land 1 and one more, Smash 64.

development_findings.summary: The final four level themes are not set in stone. Kaze is considering ideas like a Wild West, casino, or comic book level, and noted the game is missing a snow or ice-themed world.
development_findings.quote: Instead of the music level if you guys have any other ideas that you think are better let me know because we might actually just do those.

development_findings.summary: Kaze decided to completely redesign the game's overworld with a tropical island theme, an idea inspired by playing a Mario Party board.
development_findings.quote: There was actually an idea yesterday. We were playing Mario Party. And I'm thinking we should theme the island for the overworld like this. You know, tropical island.

development_findings.summary: Kaze follows a strict design guideline for vertical placement of stars and item boxes, though he will make exceptions for visibility.
development_findings.quote: In RTYI I actually have the guideline that every star is exactly 200 floors, boxes are 300.

context_findings.summary: Kaze wants to keep his personal identity separate from the final game to protect its longevity from any future personal controversies.
context_findings.quote: The player shouldn't even know that I exist when he plays this game. That way, if in the future I get cancelled on Twitter, no one has to put down the game.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expressed his philosophy that it's crucial to understand the root cause of a bug rather than just accepting a fix that works for unknown reasons.
context_findings.quote: You can't just be like, 'oh it works, good enough.' You have to be like, 'why the fuck is it not doing what I expect to do?'

context_findings.summary: Kaze and his wife, Zeina, are moving to a new house the day after the stream. Future streams will be from his new office, which he refers to as his 'dungeon'.
Kaze believes Donkey Kong 64 has strong visual charm but finds the gameplay to be one of the worst experiences.
context_findings.quote: I think DK64 is a very charming piece of shit. It's like really cool to look at, but playing it is like the worst thing ever.

biobak.summary: Provided several complex, animated assets for the star select screens, including a submarine scene with glowing lights and a scene with an animated bird.
Communicated specific animation parameters and feedback through the stream chat, guiding Kaze on how to implement the assets as intended.
Collaborated with Kaze in real-time to debug and refine the implementation of his art, clarifying technical details like animation speeds and offsets.
biobak.quote: Your Waves are the same speed Biobak. What did you mean by one of them is slowed down by 0.5? Did you maybe mean that one of them was offset by 0.5?

zeina.summary: When asked about a previous game, Zeina recalled the 'weeb toad' character as the most memorable due to how traumatizing she found it.
zeina.quote: I think I'm still slightly traumatized from the weeb toad... That's the only character I can remember.

zeina.summary: Kaze revealed that Zeina demanded he change his text notification tone from the Fly Guy's laugh because it frequently scared people.
Zeina was present off-camera during the stream and had minor interactions, such as tripping over a pot and answering a question Kaze posed to her.

key_stories.title: The Mysterious Sine Wave Compiler Bug
key_stories.summary: Kaze struggled to implement a simple sine wave animation for a submarine. After extensive debugging, he discovered the root cause was not his logic, but a silent compiler error where a missing library inclusion caused the function to link to garbage data, leading to unpredictable results.
key_stories.challenge: An animated submarine asset from Biobak was behaving erratically, flying wildly instead of following a smooth sine wave path.
key_stories.process: Kaze spent a long time debugging the animation logic, checking parameters, and printing values, assuming the error was in his code. He eventually realized he had forgotten to include the math library, and the compiler silently linked the sine function to garbage data instead of throwing an error.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze fixed the bug by adding the missing '#include <math.h>' to the code. The experience highlighted a frustrating quirk of his compiler toolchain.
key_stories.key_quote: How did it just link the sign table to a random thing instead of telling me that there's no sign table? I take no blame for that.

key_stories.title: Bringing the Star Select Bird to Life
key_stories.summary: Kaze implemented a detailed bird animation from Biobak, expressing delight at its lifelike details. He encountered a technical hurdle where the animation freezes during the level transition and devised a plan to fix it later, showing the iterative process of feature implementation.
key_stories.challenge: Implement a complex, multi-stage bird animation from Biobak for a star select screen, including idle and takeoff sequences that interact with the UI.
key_stories.process: Kaze imported the model and animations, coding the logic for the bird's idle state. When implementing the takeoff sequence triggered by a button press, he noticed the animation would freeze. He identified the cause as the fadeout function halting other updates and planned a workaround.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze successfully implemented the idle animation but discovered a technical issue where the game freezes object animations during the level transition fade. He deferred the final fix to a later time.
key_stories.key_quote: It's so good! It's so good! The twitch! It's this little tail twitch! Yeah! This is a bird's hop in our backyard!

open_questions.context: When discussing a past project (Donkey Donkey Mario 64), Kaze mentioned a character was inspired by 'Skellux'. Zeina and another chatter, Lilaa, knew the story but refused to explain, saying it would not be disclosed.
questions: What is the full story behind the pink bob-omb being inspired by Skellux?
Why is this story treated as a secret among the team?
What does this inside joke reveal about the team's history and dynamic?

open_questions.context: Kaze stated that the entire overworld will be redesigned with a tropical island theme, an idea he got from playing Mario Party the previous day.
questions: What specific element or board in Mario Party sparked the idea for a tropical overworld?
What are the main design goals for this new overworld?
How will you balance exploration with the practical need to guide players to levels efficiently?

open_questions.context: Kaze is undecided on the themes for the game's final four levels. He rejected a 'music level' but is considering a Wild West, casino, and comic book/superhero level.
questions: What core gameplay mechanics do you envision for a 'comic book' level?
What makes a theme a good or bad fit for this game?
What are the biggest challenges in translating these abstract themes into compelling Mario 64 platforming?

open_questions.context: The stream was titled with a reference to the 'Ol' Black Boss', but Kaze did not work on it and mentioned that most of the work for it happens off-stream, making it a running joke.
questions: What is the core concept for the 'Ol' Black Boss'?
Why has its development become a recurring topic that is rarely shown on stream?
What progress has been made on it off-stream that viewers haven't seen?

open_questions.context: Kaze listed the five planned 'Retro Sections' (Paper Mario, Mario Paint, Dr. Mario, Mario Land 1, Smash 64) but admitted he wasn't fully happy with the list and was open to changes.
questions: What is your criteria for selecting a game for a Retro Section?
Which games on the current list are you least happy with, and why?
If you could pick any five games without constraints, what would your ideal list of Retro Sections be?
